Scopemount 4/21 • Palomar

By Montecruiseto on May 31, 2015

The fourth Scopemount theme for Telescope is out today. Telescope is an open-source Meteor-based web app that makes it easy for anybody to launch their own community. Go check it out!

Look

Palomar is a theme that’s great for a travel or photography community, putting an emphasis on large imagery. As usual, a lot of creative borrowing has been done. This time from the likes of TripExpert and Jelly app.

Mobile views have miniature cards, and care has been taken to provide admins with the necessary stats in a compact layout.

Quick Links

Demo

Atmosphere

Scopemount

Install

Note: Remember to set your Telescope admin settings to post ‘grid’ mode and include Embedly thumbs with a width of 700px and height of 350px.

You can install Palomar automagically through Atmosphere:

$ meteor add montecruiseto:telescope-theme-sm-palomar

Alternatively if you want to customize the theme: Download and extract the theme of your choice to your Telescope package directory and run the same command as above. Telescope will look for the local package first and use that one.

Palomar

This theme was named after the Palomar Observatory, built in 1928 and located in San Diego County, California, US, in the Palomar Mountain Range.

If you want to be notified of theme updates or new releases, you can leave your email on the Scopemount homepage. Have fun with Telescope and keep tracking the stars!
